content.text:
# 9th Academy of Country Music Awards

| ratings =
| previous = 8th
| main = ACM
| next = 10th
}}
The 9th Academy of Country Music Awards ceremony was held on March 25, 1974, at Knott's Berry Farm, Buena Park, California. It was hosted by Charlie Rich and Roger Miller.
__TOC__
Winners and nominees
Winners are shown in bold.
{| class="wikitable" style="width="
! scope="col" width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;" | Entertainer of the Year
! scope="col" width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;" | Album of the Year
|-
| style="vertical-align:top" |
* Roy Clark
** Merle Haggard
** Charlie Rich
** Johnny Rodriguez
** Mel Tillis
| style="vertical-align:top" |
* 'Behind Closed Doors — Charlie Rich'
** I Love Dixie Blues — Merle Haggard
** Introducing Johnny Rodriguez — Johnny Rodriguez
** Louisiana Woman, Mississippi Man — Conway Twitty, Loretta Lynn
** Love Is the Foundation — Loretta Lynn
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Top Female Vocalist of the Year
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Top Male Vocalist of the Year
|-

** Barbara Fairchild
** Donna Fargo
** Anne Murray
** Dolly Parton
** Susan Raye
| style="vertical-align:top" |
* Charlie Rich
** Merle Haggard
** Tom T. Hall
** Marty Robbins
** Johnny Rodriguez
** Conway Twitty

** "The Americans" — Byron MacGregor

| style="vertical-align:top" |

** "If We Make It Through December" — Merle Haggard

** "(Old Dogs, Children and) Watermelon Wine" — Tom T. Hall
